newsitem.title: FRANCE: New mad cow case turns up in France - radio.
newsitem.headline: New mad cow case turns up in France - radio.

text.p: A herd of 205 cows has been destroyed in the Mayenne department of western France after the discovery of a case of mad cow disease in the herd, French radio France Info reported on Monday.
Agriculture Ministry officials were not immediately available to confirm the report but if confirmed, it would be the tenth case of the disease in France this year and the 23rd since 1990.
Virtually all the cases discovered in France have been in the west of the country, especially in Brittany.
French officials have adopted a rigorous policy of destroying the entire herd whenever a case of mad cow disease is detected.

European beef sales have slumped since the European Union in March banned exports of British beef after scientists said there was a possibility that bovine spongiform encephalopathy, or mad cow disease, could infect humans.
